summary: This is an email chain from March 30, 2021, providing an update on the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details a superseding indictment filed on March 29, 2021, which added two new charges and extended the timeline for existing charges. The trial is noted as scheduled for July 12, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal case update; a superseding indictment was returned against her with new and expanded charges.

persons.name: Young
persons.context: The recipient of the email providing the case update, as indicated in the 'To:' field.

events.title: Superseding Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury returned a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding two new charges (Sex Trafficking of a Minor and Sex Trafficking Conspiracy) and expanding the timeline for Counts 1 and 3.

events.title: Scheduled Trial
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

keyFacts: A superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was returned on March 29, 2021.
The superseding indictment added two new charges: Sex Trafficking of a Minor and Sex Trafficking Conspiracy, covering 2001-2004.
It expanded the timeline for Count 1 (Conspiracy to Entice Minors) and Count 3 (Conspiracy to Transport Minors) from up to 1997 to up to 2004.
The trial was scheduled for July 12, 2021.
